title: Photography & Adventure
tagline: Capture Snowdonia at its most dramatic
suitableFor: Couples and keen amateur photographers of reasonable fitness who enjoy easy to moderate walks and scenic drives. Ideal for those seeking stunning landscape shots without extreme exertion.
notSuitableFor: Those with mobility issues, those seeking extreme adventure sports, or anyone who dislikes walking. Young children may find some walks too long.

stops.title: Llanberis Path Guided Walk
stops.description: A gentle ascent to the summit of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path, offering incredible panoramic views and photographic opportunities. Great for beginners.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the slate industry in a fascinating indoor museum in Llanberis.

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: A flat, easy walk around Llyn Padarn lake, with views of Snowdon and the surrounding mountains. Free parking available.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis, famous for its huge portions and hearty meals, perfect after a long hike.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Peris viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches and snacks with stunning lake views.

stops.title: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
stops.description: A comfortable and well-located hostel in Llanberis, offering a mix of private rooms and dorms. Suited for couples or individual photographers.
stops.travelToNext: 20min drive to Capel Curig (Plas y Brenin)

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan) Campsite
budgetAlt.description: Camping in Llanberis. Cheaper than a bunkhouse.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking
stops.description: Explore the stunning coastline and Menai Strait by kayak, with guidance from experienced instructors. Focus on capturing the coastal scenery and wildlife.

wetAlt.title: Rock Climbing Taster
wetAlt.description: Learn the basics of rock climbing at Plas y Brenin's indoor climbing wall.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along the Menai Strait
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Menai Strait, taking in views of the bridges and Anglesey.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic by the River Llugwy
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a packed lunch by the river in Betws-y-Coed.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: A thrilling toboggan run through the forest at Zip World Fforest, offering unique photo opportunities. Fun for all!
stops.travelToNext: 30min drive to Capel Curig or back to Llanberis

wetAlt.title: Explore Betws-y-Coed Village
wetAlt.description: Browse the shops and art galleries in the charming village of Betws-y-Coed.

budgetAlt.title: Walking in Gwydir Forest
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy free forest walks starting from Betws-y-Coed, with various trails for all abilities.

stops.title: Plas y Brenin
stops.description: A renowned national mountain sports centre, offering comfortable accommodation and stunning views. Perfect for outdoor enthusiasts.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
stops.description: A family-friendly mountain bike trail at Coed y Brenin, offering stunning forest scenery and gentle gradients. Great for beginners and photographers.
stops.travelToNext: Short drive to nearby waterfall trails

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Enjoy the cafe and exhibits at the visitor centre while waiting out the rain.

budgetAlt.title: Walking Trails at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Explore the many free walking trails through Coed y Brenin forest. Parking charges apply.

stops.title: Cafe at Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
stops.description: Quick and easy cafe at the visitor centre

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch
budgetAlt.description: Have a packed lunch at the forest picnic area.

stops.title: Waterfall trails near Dolgellau
stops.description: Visit several waterfalls in the Dolgellau area for photography. The most accessible is Rhaeadr Ddu waterfalls.
stops.travelToNext: Drive back to base, or continue exploration of Southern Snowdonia

wetAlt.title: Visit the town of Dolgellau
wetAlt.description: Browse the shops and have a coffee

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: September-November can be wet and windy, but also offers stunning autumn colours and dramatic light. Check the forecast before you set off each day.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Snowdonia, especially on weekends and during school holidays. Parking at popular spots like Pen-y-Pass fills up early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Book Zip World activities and guided hikes well in advance, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked ahead of time.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary involves moderate walking and some gentle activity. A reasonable level of fitness is required.
